summary: The bill, titled the Jobs and Opportunities for Medicaid Act, aims to amend Title XIX of the Social Security Act to implement a work requirement for able-bodied adults enrolled in state Medicaid programs.  Starting January 1, 2026, it would deny medical assistance to able-bodied adults who do not meet a minimum work or volunteer hour requirement. The bill defines "able-bodied adult" and outlines exemptions, such as those under 18 or over 65, medically unfit, pregnant, or primary caregivers of young children.
